dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 3323 RH: Helping Startups Continue To Grow Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Steil (for himself and Mrs. Wagner) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on May 13, 2025

form.official-title: To update the definition of an emerging growth company, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Helping Startups Continue To Grow Act.

subsection.text: Section 2(a)(19) of the Securities Act of 1933 (15 U.S.C. 77b(a)(19)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking $1,000,000,000 each place such term appears and inserting $3,000,000,000;

subparagraph.text: by striking fifth and inserting 10-year; and
by adding or at the end;

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (C), by striking ; or and inserting a period; and

subsection.text: Section 3(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (15 U.S.C. 78c(a)) is amended, in the first paragraph (80)—

paragraph.text: by striking $1,000,000,000 each place such term appears and inserting $3,000,000,000;

subparagraph.text: by striking fifth and inserting 10-year; and
by adding or at the end;

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (C), by striking ; or and inserting a period; and
Section 3(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (15 U.S.C. 78c(a)) is amended by redesignating the second paragraph (80) as paragraph (81).
Section 4A(a)(1)(B) of the Securities Act of 1933 (77d–1(a)(1)(B)) is amended by striking section 3(a)(80) and inserting section 3(a).

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
